intro: Euacer affine, commonly known as the narrowleaf euacer, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae, which includes many familiar plants such as roses and strawberries. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, woodland areas and is often found in the understory of forests. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that ripens in late summer, attracting various bird species.
